ground_truth: Harry smiles and winks, but a truck briefly blocks Peter's view, and when it passes, Harry has disappeared from the coffee shop. Peter turns and looks around the street, eyes wide, mouth half open. Later, he sits on the bed in his room, hands clasped between his knees, staring ahead with a cold and malevolent expression. Slowly, his eyes swivel to the corner of the room, and he turns his head toward the black trunk on the floor of the closet. Lightning flashes in a dark sky. In his father's study, Harry pours himself a martini and adds a couple of olives. Sensing Peter behind him, he smiles without looking around and sips his drink. Peter, wearing the black suit under his normal clothes, punches Harry. Peter's eyes widen as Harry stabs him in the thigh with a dagger. As they fight, a row of curved blades shoot out from Harry's forearm. Peter hauls him into a pummeled wall, and Harry swings at it, smashing his arm at Peter's head, but the blades get stuck in the pillar behind. Peter slams his fist down on Harry's arm, breaking off the blades. Harry kicks him across the table, and they circle each other. Peter kicks Harry through a glass partition, and Harry wipes blood from his mouth, diving at Peter who hauls him against another window. Peter throws Harry across the room, and Harry picks himself up. They run at each other and crash through into the secret goblin lair. As Peter chases him through the lair, Harry picks up the goblin sword and swings it at him, but Peter dodges the blade. Harry accidentally cuts through the table, tethering the sky stick, sending it spinning out of control. Peter pushes Harry's head up into the path of the sky stick, and Harry is thrown against a wall of glass shelves, crashing to the ground. Peter floors Harry with a final blow and walks away. Harry finds a pumpkin bomb and hurls it after him, but Peter lassos the bomb with a web and hauls it back, exploding in Harry's face. Peter strolls along a street, fastening his shirt collar over the Black Spider-Man suit, and several women passing by give him the eye. At a newsstand, the Daily Bugle photo shows Black Spider-Man robbing a bank. In the Bugle office, Brock is celebrating and hangs up a framed blowup of the front page. Peter comes up behind him and drops a photo on the desk, slamming Brock against the wall. Brock looks around, smiling nervously. Peter hands Robby, the sub-editor, the original print from which Brock faked the bank robbery shot. In Jameson's office, Jameson slaps the photo down. Floppy-haired Peter is in his hallway with Ursula.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Harry grins and blinks, but a lorry momentarily obstructs Peter's sight, and when it moves, Harry has vanished from the café. Peter swivels and glances around the boulevard, eyes broad, mouth partially ajar. Later, he perches on the cot in his chamber, hands folded between his legs, gazing forward with a chilly and hostile expression. Gradually, his eyes rotate to the corner of the chamber, and he pivots his head toward the ebony chest on the floor of the wardrobe. Lightning illuminates in a shadowy sky. In his father's office, Harry pours himself a cocktail and adds a pair of olives. Perceiving Peter behind him, he grins without turning and sips his beverage. Peter, donning the dark suit beneath his usual garments, punches Harry. Peter's eyes enlarge as Harry thrusts him in the thigh with a knife. As they grapple, a line of arched blades eject from Harry's forearm. Peter drags him into a battered partition, and Harry swings at it, shattering his limb at Peter's head, but the blades become lodged in the column behind. Peter pounds his hand down on Harry's arm, snapping off the blades. Harry kicks him across the table, and they revolve around each other. Peter kicks Harry through a pane divider, and Harry wipes blood from his mouth, lunging at Peter who drags him against another window. Peter hurls Harry across the chamber, and Harry gathers himself. They dash at each other and smash through into the hidden goblin den. As Peter pursues him through the den, Harry grabs the goblin sword and swings it at him, but Peter evades the blade. Harry mistakenly slices through the table, tethering the sky stick, sending it whirling out of control. Peter thrusts Harry's head up into the route of the sky stick, and Harry is hurled against a wall of glass racks, crashing to the ground. Peter floors Harry with a terminal hit and strides away. Harry discovers a pumpkin bomb and flings it after him, but Peter lassos the bomb with a web and drags it back, detonating in Harry's face. Peter saunters along a boulevard, fastening his shirt collar over the Black Spider-Man attire, and several females passing by give him the eye. At a kiosk, the Daily Bugle photograph exhibits Black Spider-Man looting a bank. In the Bugle office, Brock is rejoicing and hangs up a framed enlargement of the front page. Peter approaches behind him and drops a photograph on the desk, slamming Brock against the partition. Brock glances around, grinning apprehensively. Peter hands Robby, the sub-editor, the original image from which Brock forged the bank heist picture. In Jameson's office, Jameson slaps the photograph down. Floppy-haired Peter is in his corridor with Ursula.

The black suit is worn by Peter under his normal clothes, and he punches Harry. Harry stabs him in the thigh with a dagger, widening Peter's eyes. While they fight, Harry's forearm shoots out a row of curved blades. Harry is hauled by Peter into a pummeled wall, and it is swung at by Harry, smashing his arm at Peter's head, but the blades get stuck in the pillar behind. Harry's arm is slammed down on by Peter's fist, breaking off the blades. Harry is kicked by Peter across the table, and they circle each other. Harry is kicked through a glass partition by Peter, and blood is wiped from his mouth by Harry, diving at Peter who hauls him against another window. Harry is thrown across the room by Peter, and he picks himself up. They run at each other and crash through into the secret goblin lair. Through the lair, Harry is chased by Peter, and he picks up the goblin sword and swings it at him, but the blade is dodged by Peter. Harry accidentally cuts through the table, tethering the sky stick, sending it spinning out of control. Harry's head is pushed by Peter up into the path of the sky stick, and he is thrown against a wall of glass shelves, crashing to the ground. Harry is floored by Peter with a final blow and walks away. A pumpkin bomb is found by Harry and hurled after him, but the bomb is lassoed by Peter with a web and hauled back, exploding in Harry's face. Peter strolls along a street, fastening his shirt collar over the Black Spider-Man suit, and the eye is given to him by several women passing by. The Daily Bugle photo is shown at a newsstand, displaying Black Spider-Man robbing a bank. In the Bugle office, Brock celebrates and hangs up a framed blowup of the front page. Peter comes up behind him and drops a photo on the desk, slamming Brock against the wall. Around is looked by Brock, smiling nervously. Robby, the sub-editor, is handed the original print by Peter, from which the bank robbery shot was faked by Brock. In Jameson's office, the photo is slapped down by Jameson. Floppy-haired Peter is with Ursula in his hallway.

test_cases.description: Harry smiles and winks, but a truck briefly obstructs Peter's view. When it passes, Harry vanishes from the coffee shop. Peter looks around the street, eyes wide and mouth half open. Later, he sits in his room, staring ahead with a cold expression, eyes shifting to the black trunk in the closet. Lightning flashes in the dark sky. In his father's study, Harry, sensing Peter, pours a martini and smiles without turning. Peter, in a black suit under his clothes, punches Harry. Harry stabs Peter's thigh with a dagger. As they fight, blades shoot from Harry's forearm. Peter breaks the blades against a pummeled wall and Harry kicks him across a table. Peter kicks Harry through a glass partition. They crash into the secret goblin lair, and Harry swings a goblin sword at Peter, missing and unleashing the sky stick. Peter pushes Harry into its path, and Harry crashes into glass shelves. Peter floors him with a final blow, walking away. Harry finds a pumpkin bomb and throws it, but Peter webs it back, exploding in Harry's face. Peter strolls, fastening his shirt over the Black Spider-Man suit, catching women's attention. At a newsstand, the Daily Bugle shows Black Spider-Man robbing a bank. In the Bugle office, Brock celebrates, hanging a framed blowup. Peter confronts Brock, slamming him against the wall, and gives Robby the original print proving the bank robbery shot was faked. In Jameson’s office, Jameson angrily slaps the photo down. Floppy-haired Peter is in the hallway with Ursula.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Harry smiles and winks, but a truck briefly blocks Peter's view. When it passes, Harry has disappeared from the coffee shop. Peter looks around the street, later sitting in his room with a cold expression, eyes on the black trunk in the closet. Lightning flashes. In his father's study, Harry pours a martini, sensing Peter behind him, smiles, and sips his drink. Peter, wearing the black suit under his clothes, punches Harry. Peter's eyes widen as Harry stabs him in the thigh. They fight, and blades shoot from Harry's arm. Peter breaks the blades, kicking Harry through a glass partition. Harry dives at Peter, who throws him against another window. They crash into the secret goblin lair. Harry picks up a goblin sword, but Peter dodges. The sword cuts through a table, sending the sky stick out of control. Peter pushes Harry's head into its path, throwing him against glass shelves. Peter floors Harry and walks away. Harry throws a pumpkin bomb, but Peter lassos it back, exploding in Harry's face. Peter walks along the street, fastening his collar over the Black Spider-Man suit, drawing attention from women. At a newsstand, the Daily Bugle shows Black Spider-Man robbing a bank. In the office, Brock celebrates with a framed blowup. Peter drops a photo on Brock's desk, slamming him against the wall, then gives Robby the original print Brock faked. In Jameson's office, Jameson slaps the photo down. Floppy-haired Peter is in his hallway with Ursula.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Harry, with a charming smile and a playful wink, momentarily engages Peter's attention. However, a large truck inconveniently blocks Peter's view for a brief moment, and by the time it moves on, Harry has mysteriously vanished from the bustling coffee shop. In response, Peter turns quickly and begins to scan the busy street around him, his eyes widening and his mouth slightly agape in surprise. Subsequently, Peter finds himself seated on the edge of his bed in the familiarity of his own room, his hands clasped tightly between his knees. He sits there staring straight ahead, his expression cold and filled with a menacing intensity. Gradually, his gaze shifts toward the corner of the room, leading him to turn his head in the direction of a mysterious black trunk positioned on the floor of his closet. The dark sky outside lights up briefly with a flash of lightning. Meanwhile, in the distinguished setting of his father's study, Harry leisurely pours himself a martini, carefully adding a couple of olives to the mix. With an acute awareness of Peter's presence behind him, he smiles subtly without bothering to turn around and takes a measured sip of his drink. Peter, now visibly wearing the Black Spider-Man suit concealed beneath his regular clothes, lashes out and punches Harry. In retaliation, Harry sharpens his focus and, with a dagger, stabs Peter in the thigh, causing Peter's eyes to widen in shock. As their intense fight continues, a series of curved blades suddenly shoot out from Harry's forearm. Peter, with decisive strength, hauls Harry into a battered wall. Harry retaliates by swinging the arm with the blades aimed directly at Peter's head, but the blades become lodged in the pillar behind him. In quick succession, Peter slams his fist down on Harry's arm, effectively snapping off the blades. Undeterred, Harry kicks Peter across the table as they continue to circle each other with determination. Peter then kicks Harry forcefully through a fragile glass partition. Harry, undeterred, wipes the blood from his mouth before diving at Peter, who counters by hauling him against another window. Peter hurls Harry, sending him flying across the room, but Harry quickly regains his footing. They both run at each other fiercely and crash through into the hidden and foreboding goblin lair. As Peter relentlessly chases Harry through the lair, Harry seizes the goblin sword and swings it with intent at Peter. Still, Peter skillfully dodges the incoming blade. In an unfortunate mishap, Harry inadvertently slices through the table that supports the sky stick, causing it to spiral chaotically out of control. Seizing the opportunity, Peter pushes Harry’s head into the path of the wild sky stick, causing Harry to be violently thrown against a wall lined with glass shelves, subsequently crashing to the ground. With a decisive final blow, Peter floors Harry before turning to walk away. However, in a last-ditch effort, Harry finds a pumpkin bomb and hurls it furiously after Peter. Yet, with skillful agility, Peter uses his web to lasso the bomb and redirects it, causing an explosion in Harry's face. Later, Peter calmly strolls down a lively street, discreetly fastening his shirt collar over the conspicuous Black Spider-Man suit. Several women pass by, casting admiring glances in his direction. At a nearby newsstand, the prominent photo on the front page of the Daily Bugle displays Black Spider-Man in the act of robbing a bank. Within the bustling Bugle office, Brock is seen celebrating his apparent success, triumphantly hanging up a large framed display of the front page. Peter approaches quietly from behind and decisively drops a revealing photo onto the desk, aggressively slamming Brock against the wall. Brock, now visibly anxious, looks around with a strained nervous smile. Peter hands over to Robby, the sub-editor, the original print that exposes Brock's fraudulent bank robbery shot. In the office of the stern Jameson, the photo is slapped down with authority. Meanwhile, Peter, with his distinctive floppy hair, stands in his hallway in conversation with Ursula.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: Harry, with an irresistibly charming smile and a playful wink that could grab anyone's attention, momentarily captures Peter's focus. However, an inconveniently large truck obstructs Peter's line of sight just for a brief moment, and by the time the truck continues on its way, Harry has mysteriously disappeared from the bustling coffee shop. In a swift response, Peter rapidly turns around and begins to scan the busy street surrounding him, his eyes widening in surprise and his mouth slightly agape. In the next moment, Peter finds himself seated precariously on the edge of his bed, enveloped within the familiar space of his room, his hands tightly clasped between his knees. He sits there staring intently straight ahead, his face set in a cold expression filled with menacing intensity. Gradually, his gaze shifts toward the corner of his room, prompting him to turn his head in the direction of a mysterious black trunk resting on the floor of his closet. The dark sky outside is illuminated briefly by a sudden flash of lightning. Meanwhile, in the distinguished ambiance of his father's study, Harry leisurely pours himself a martini, taking care to add a couple of olives to complete the classic cocktail. With an acute awareness of Peter's presence behind him, he smiles subtly without even bothering to turn around and takes a deliberately measured sip of his drink. Peter, now visibly wearing the Black Spider-Man suit concealed beneath his everyday clothes, lashes out fiercely and punches Harry. In retaliation, Harry sharpens his focus and, wielding a dagger, stabs Peter in the thigh, causing Peter's eyes to widen with shock and pain. As their intense fight escalates, a series of curved blades suddenly extends from Harry's forearm. Peter, with decisive strength and determination, hauls Harry into a battered wall. Harry retaliates immediately by swinging the arm with the blades aimed squarely at Peter's head, but the blades become lodged in the pillar behind him. In a swift succession of movements, Peter slams his fist down on Harry's arm, effectively snapping the blades off. Undeterred by the setback, Harry kicks Peter across the table as they continue to circle each other with fierce determination. Peter then kicks Harry with enough force to send him crashing through a fragile glass partition. Undeterred, Harry wipes the blood from his mouth before diving at Peter, who counters by forcibly hauling him against another window. Peter hurls Harry, sending him flying across the room, but Harry quickly recovers his footing. They both run at each other with fierce energy and crash through into the hidden and foreboding goblin lair. As Peter relentlessly chases Harry through the lair, Harry seizes the goblin sword and swings it with malicious intent at Peter. Yet, Peter skillfully dodges the incoming blade. In an unfortunate mishap, Harry inadvertently slices through the table that supports the sky stick, causing it to spiral chaotically out of control. Seizing the opportunity, Peter pushes Harry’s head into the path of the wildly swirling sky stick, causing Harry to be violently thrown against a wall lined with glass shelves, subsequently crashing to the ground. With a decisive final blow, Peter floors Harry before turning his back to walk away. However, in a desperate last-ditch effort, Harry finds a pumpkin bomb and hurls it furiously after Peter. Yet, with remarkable skill and agility, Peter uses his web to lasso the bomb and cleverly redirects it, resulting in an explosion in Harry's face. Later on, Peter calmly strolls down a lively and vibrant street, discreetly fastening his shirt collar over the conspicuous Black Spider-Man suit. Several women passing by cast admiring glances in his direction. At a nearby newsstand, the prominent photo displayed on the front page of the Daily Bugle shows Black Spider-Man in the act of robbing a bank. Within the bustling office of the Bugle, Brock is seen celebrating his apparent success, triumphantly hanging up a large framed copy of the front page. Peter approaches quietly from behind and decisively drops a revealing photo onto the desk, aggressively slamming Brock against the wall. Brock, now visibly anxious, looks around with a strained and nervous smile. Peter hands over to Robby, the sub-editor, the original print that exposes Brock's fraudulent bank robbery shot. In the office of the stern Jameson, the photo is slapped down with authority. Meanwhile, Peter, characterized by his distinctive floppy hair, stands in his hallway engaged in conversation with Ursula.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Harry, seated in the bustling coffee shop, directs a warm smile and a wink toward Peter. As Peter observes this interaction, a large truck momentarily obstructs his line of sight. Once it passes, Peter finds that Harry has mysteriously vanished from the coffee shop. Confused, Peter turns his head, scanning the street with wide eyes and his mouth slightly agape, searching for any sign of Harry. Later, in the quiet of his room, Peter sits heavily on his bed, his hands tightly clasped between his knees. He stares blankly ahead, a chilling and malevolent look etched on his face. His eyes gradually shift to the corner of the room as he slowly turns his head to focus on the black trunk resting ominously on the closet floor. Suddenly, the sky outside darkens with a flash of lightning, illuminating his father's study where Harry is calmly pouring himself a martini, carefully adding a couple of olives to the glass. With a perceptive sense of Peter's presence behind him, Harry grins slyly without turning around and takes a measured sip of his drink. In a swift move, Peter, now donning the black suit beneath his ordinary clothes, lunges forward and punches Harry. Surprised, Peter's eyes widen as he feels the sharp pain of a dagger stabbed into his thigh by Harry. They engage in a fierce struggle, during which a set of curved blades suddenly eject from Harry's forearm. Peter maneuvers Harry into a battered wall, prompting Harry to swing at Peter's head, but the blades become lodged in the pillar behind them. Seizing the opportunity, Peter forcefully slams his fist down on Harry's arm, snapping off the blades. In retaliation, Harry delivers a powerful kick, sending Peter sprawling across the table as they circle each other, both seething with intensity. Peter retaliates with a swift kick that sends Harry crashing through a glass partition. Wiping blood from his mouth, Harry charges at Peter, who counters by hurling him against yet another window. With a burst of strength, Peter throws Harry across the room, and Harry picks himself up, determined not to be defeated. They sprint toward each other, crashing through into a hidden goblin lair, where the battle rages on. As Peter relentlessly pursues Harry through the lair, Harry seizes the goblin sword, swinging it menacingly at Peter, who agilely dodges the strike. In his urgency, Harry inadvertently slices through the table tethering the sky stick, causing it to spin wildly out of control. Taking advantage of the chaos, Peter pushes Harry's head into the path of the errant sky stick, propelling Harry forcefully against a wall of glass shelves, where he crashes to the ground. Seizing the moment, Peter lands a decisive blow, flooring Harry and decisively stepping away. Desperate, Harry discovers a pumpkin bomb and hurls it toward Peter, but with deft agility, Peter weaves a web that captures the bomb, pulling it back to explode directly in Harry's face. Striding along a street with a nonchalant air, Peter adjusts his shirt collar over the Black Spider-Man suit, catching the appreciative glances of several women passing by. At a nearby newsstand, a copy of the Daily Bugle prominently features a photo of Black Spider-Man supposedly robbing a bank. Meanwhile, in the bustling office of the Bugle, Brock revels in triumph, proudly displaying a framed blowup of the sensational front page. However, Peter arrives with a determined presence, approaching from behind as he drops a telling photo onto the desk, forcefully shoving Brock against the wall. With a nervous smile, Brock surveys the room, sensing vulnerability. Peter hands Robby, the sub-editor, the authentic original print that exposes Brock's forgery of the bank robbery image. In the office of Jameson, the editor-in-chief, the incriminating photo lands on his desk with a telling slap. The scene transitions to Peter, hair unkempt, standing in his hallway, engaged in a moment with Ursula, signaling a shift in events.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Harry winks at Peter before a passing truck temporarily obstructs Peter's view. When it clears, Harry has vanished from the coffee shop. Peter, perplexed, scans the street and later appears deep in thought on his bed, focusing intently on a black trunk in his closet. In a different scene, Harry prepares a martini in his father's study, aware of Peter's presence behind him. Peter, clad in a black suit beneath his regular clothes, confronts Harry with a punch. During the ensuing battle, Harry injures Peter with a dagger, and as they fight, Harry's forearm blades extend. Peter maneuvers Harry into a wall, causing the blades to lodge in a pillar, then breaks them off. The fight escalates, with Peter kicking Harry through glass and Harry retaliating. Their struggle takes them into a secret goblin lair, where Harry wields a sword. Peter evades Harry's attacks, leading to an accidental disruption of the sky stick. Seizing the opportunity, Peter directs Harry into the path of the sky stick, sending him crashing into glass shelves. As Peter departs, Harry hurls a pumpkin bomb, but Peter expertly snares it with a web, causing it to explode in Harry's face. Peter then walks down a street, adjusting his shirt collar to conceal the Black Spider-Man suit, drawing attention from several women. At a newsstand, a Daily Bugle headline accuses Black Spider-Man of a bank robbery. In the Bugle office, Brock celebrates and displays a blown-up front page. Peter confronts Brock with evidence of his forged photo, presenting the original to Robby, the sub-editor. Jameson reviews the proof in his office, while Peter later interacts with Ursula in his hallway.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Harry, known for his enigmatic and elusive nature, smiles and winks, but a truck briefly blocks Peter's view, and when it passes, Harry has disappeared from the coffee shop that serves as their frequent meeting spot in the bustling city. Peter turns and looks around the street, eyes wide, mouth half open, as if searching for clues in the familiar urban chaos. Later, he sits on the bed in his room, hands clasped between his knees, staring ahead with a cold and malevolent expression reminiscent of the hardened criminals he reads about in the Daily Bugle. Slowly, his eyes swivel to the corner of the room, and he turns his head toward the black trunk on the floor of the closet, which holds remnants of his father's past, a legacy shrouded in mystery. Lightning flashes in a dark sky, mirroring the stormy emotions Peter feels inside. In his father's study, a space filled with rich mahogany and the scent of old books, Harry pours himself a martini and adds a couple of olives, a drink that was his father's favorite. Sensing Peter behind him, he smiles without looking around and sips his drink, a gesture of calm amidst brewing conflict. Peter, wearing the black suit under his normal clothes, punches Harry, drawing upon the powers granted by the alien symbiote that bonds with the suit. Peter's eyes widen as Harry stabs him in the thigh with a dagger, a weapon handed down through generations of his family. As they fight, a row of curved blades shoot out from Harry's forearm, an upgrade from his goblin technology arsenal. Peter hauls him into a pummeled wall, and Harry swings at it, smashing his arm at Peter's head, but the blades get stuck in the pillar behind, a structural remnant from the building's original design. Peter slams his fist down on Harry's arm, breaking off the blades, a tactic learned from his close encounters with other superpowered individuals. Harry kicks him across the table, and they circle each other in a dance of adrenaline and vengeance. Peter kicks Harry through a glass partition, and Harry wipes blood from his mouth, diving at Peter who hauls him against another window. Peter throws Harry across the room, and Harry picks himself up with the resilience he's known for. They run at each other and crash through into the secret goblin lair, a hidden chamber filled with the paraphernalia of Harry's dark alter ego. As Peter chases him through the lair, Harry picks up the goblin sword, a relic from his father's collection, and swings it at him, but Peter dodges the blade with the agility of the spider. Harry accidentally cuts through the table tethering the sky stick, an advanced hoverboard, sending it spinning out of control. Peter pushes Harry's head up into the path of the sky stick, and Harry is thrown against a wall of glass shelves, crashing to the ground amidst shattered memories. Peter floors Harry with a final blow and walks away, feeling the weight of his actions. Harry finds a pumpkin bomb, one of his signature weapons, and hurls it after him, but Peter lassos the bomb with a web, showcasing his mastery over his web-shooters, and hauls it back, exploding in Harry's face. Peter strolls along a street, a usually vibrant avenue now echoing with the aftermath of their battle, fastening his shirt collar over the Black Spider-Man suit, and several women passing by give him the eye, attracted to his newfound confidence. At a newsstand, the Daily Bugle, a tabloid notorious for sensational headlines, photo shows Black Spider-Man robbing a bank, fueling Peter's infamy. In the Bugle office, Brock is celebrating and hangs up a framed blowup of the front page, unaware of the impending truth. Peter comes up behind him and drops a photo on the desk, slamming Brock against the wall as if to imprint the magnitude of his deceit. Brock looks around, smiling nervously, realizing his facade is cracking. Peter hands Robby, the sub-editor renowned for his integrity, the original print from which Brock faked the bank robbery shot. In Jameson's office, a place of chaos and ambition, Jameson slaps the photo down, uncovering the scandal with a mix of fury and relief. Floppy-haired Peter is in his hallway with Ursula, a neighbor whose quiet kindness often goes unnoticed amidst his turbulent life.

In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Peter pushes Harry's head up into the path of the sky stick and Harry is thrown against a wall of glass shelves crashing to the ground. Peter floors Harry with a final blow and walks away. Harry finds a pumpkin bomb and hurls it after him but Peter lassos the bomb with a web and hauls it back exploding in Harry's face. Peter strolls along a street fastening his shirt collar over the Black SpiderMan suit and several women passing by give him the eye. At a newsstand the Daily Bugle photo shows Black SpiderMan robbing a bank. In the Bugle office Brock is celebrating and hangs up a framed blowup of the front page. Peter comes up behind him and drops a photo on the desk slamming Brock against the wall. Brock looks around smiling nervously. Peter hands Robby the subeditor the original print from which Brock faked the bank robbery shot. In Jameson's office Jameson slaps the photo down. Floppyhaired Peter is in his hallway with Ursula.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: Harry smiles and winks but a truck briefly blocks Peter's view and when it passes Harry has disappeared from the coffee shop. Peter turns and looks around the street eyes wide mouth half open. Later he sits on the bed in his room hands clasped between his knees staring ahead with a cold and malevolent expression. Slowly his eyes swivel to the corner of the room and he turns his head toward the black trunk on the floor of the closet. Lightning flashes in a dark sky. In his father's study Harry pours himself a martini and adds a couple of olives. Sensing Peter behind him he smiles without looking around and sips his drink. Peter wearing the black suit under his normal clothes punches Harry Peter's eyes widen as Harry stabs him in the thigh with a dagger. As they fight a row of curved blades shoot out from Harry's forearm. Peter hauls him into a pummeled wall and Harry swings at it smashing his arm at Peter's head but the blades get stuck in the pillar behind. Peter slams his fist down on Harry's arm breaking off the blades. Harry kicks him across the table and they circle each other. Peter kicks Harry through a glass partition and Harry wipes blood from his mouth diving at Peter who hauls him against another window. Peter throws Harry across the room and Harry picks himself up. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. They run at each other and crash through into the secret goblin lair. As Peter chases him through the lair Harry picks up the goblin sword and swings it at him but Peter dodges the blade. Harry accidentally cuts through the table tethering the sky stick sending it spinning out of control. Peter pushes Harry's head up into the path of the sky stick and Harry is thrown against a wall of glass shelves crashing to the ground. Peter floors Harry with a final blow and walks away. Harry finds a pumpkin bomb and hurls it after him but Peter lassos the bomb with a web and hauls it back exploding in Harry's face. Peter strolls along a street fastening his shirt collar over the Black SpiderMan suit and several women passing by give him the eye. At a newsstand the Daily Bugle photo shows Black SpiderMan robbing a bank. In the Bugle office Brock is celebrating and hangs up a framed blowup of the front page. Peter comes up behind him and drops a photo on the desk slamming Brock against the wall. Brock looks around smiling nervously. Peter hands Robby the subeditor the original print from which Brock faked the bank robbery shot. In Jameson's office Jameson slaps the photo down. Floppyhaired Peter is in his hallway with Ursula.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Oliver chuckles and nods, but a balloon briefly obscures Tom's gaze, and when it drifts away, Oliver has vanished from the pizzeria. Tom spins and scans the park, eyes wide, lips slightly apart. Later, he lounges on the sofa in his den, fingers intertwined beneath his chin, glaring forward with a chilly and sinister demeanor. Gradually, his eyes shift to the corner of the den, and he tilts his head toward the red suitcase on the carpet of the attic. Thunder booms in a stormy night. In his uncle's library, Oliver brews himself a tea and tosses in a couple of lemon slices. Noticing Tom behind him, he chuckles without turning and sips his beverage. Tom, donning the blue jacket under his typical attire, elbows Oliver. Tom's eyes widen as Oliver jabs him in the calf with a harpoon. As they scuffle, a line of spiked chains launch from Oliver's wrist. Tom slams him into a dented door, and Oliver swings at it, bashing his knee at Tom's chest, but the chains get lodged in the beam above. Tom bats his hand down on Oliver's wrist, snapping off the chains. Oliver shoves him across the counter, and they pace around one another. Tom shoves Oliver through a wooden railing, and Oliver dabs blood from his chin, leaping at Tom who pushes him against another barrier. Tom flings Oliver across the office, and Oliver gathers himself up. They charge at one another and burst through into the hidden cavern stronghold. As Tom pursues him through the stronghold, Oliver grabs the cavern lance and strikes it at him, but Tom evades the spear. Oliver inadvertently slices through the pedestal, anchoring the sky cycle, sending it spiraling chaotically. Tom thrusts Oliver's face up into the trajectory of the sky cycle, and Oliver is hurled against a panel of metal racks, collapsing to the floor. Tom floors Oliver with a conclusive strike and strides away. Oliver finds a coconut grenade and flings it after him, but Tom ropes the grenade with a vine and slings it back, detonating in Oliver's visage. Tom meanders along an avenue, adjusting his hat brim over the White Shadow costume, and several men wandering by give him a glance. At a kiosk, the Evening Herald picture shows White Shadow heisting a store. In the Herald bureau, Nick is rejoicing and hangs up an enlarged replica of the cover story. Tom sneaks up behind him and drops a snapshot on the counter, shoving Nick against the partition. Nick glances around, grinning uneasily. Tom hands Rick, the associate-editor, the authentic image from which Nick forged the store heist photo. In Johnson's bureau, Johnson slams the snapshot down. Curly-haired Tom is in his hallway with Lisa.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Peter witnesses Harry mysteriously disappear from a coffee shop, leading to a cold, pensive moment alone. In a confrontation at Harry's home, Peter dons a black suit and attacks Harry. A fierce battle ensues, leading them into Harry's secret goblin lair. During the fight, Peter manages to turn Harry's weapons against him, ultimately defeating him. Harry's last attempt to attack Peter with a pumpkin bomb backfires due to Peter's quick-thinking retaliatory web-slinging. Peter is seen strolling down the street, confidently adjusting his shirt over the Black Spider-Man suit, attracting attention from onlookers. Meanwhile, in the Daily Bugle office, Brock celebrates a faked photo of Spider-Man robbing a bank, but Peter confronts him with the original image proving the photo's falsity. Peter presents the evidence to Jameson, revealing Brock's deception.
